Paginator.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.ui.table.NavigationMode.Scrollbar}
Uses the paginator control. This option must no longer be used. Using a scrollbar is the only navigation mode which is supported by the sap.ui.table library. The navigationMode property has always been a visual representation. No matter which navigation mode is used, data fetched from an OData service is loaded page-wise.
Paginator.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.ui.table.NavigationMode.Scrollbar}
Uses the paginator control. This option must no longer be used. Using a scrollbar is the only navigation mode which is supported by the sap.ui.table library. The navigationMode property has always been a visual representation. No matter which navigation mode is used, data fetched from an OData service is loaded page-wise.

HorizontalScrollBar.description: The element id of the Horizontal Scroll Bar of the sap.ui.table.Table.
HorizontalScrollBar.helpDescription: The element id of the Horizontal Scroll Bar of the sap.ui.table.Table.

VerticalScrollBar.description: The element id of the Vertical Scroll Bar of the sap.ui.table.Table.
VerticalScrollBar.helpDescription: The element id of the Vertical Scroll Bar of the sap.ui.table.Table.

Auto.description:
The table automatically fills the height of the surrounding container.
The visibleRowCount property is automatically changed accordingly.
All rows need the same height, otherwise the auto mode doesn't always work as expected.
The height of all siblings within the same layout container of the table will be subtracted from the available height.
For performance reasons, it is recommended to add no siblings in the table's parent container.
Auto.helpDescription:
The table automatically fills the height of the surrounding container.
The visibleRowCount property is automatically changed accordingly.
All rows need the same height, otherwise the auto mode doesn't always work as expected.
The height of all siblings within the same layout container of the table will be subtracted from the available height.
For performance reasons, it is recommended to add no siblings in the table's parent container.

Interactive.description: After rendering the table has as many rows as defined in visibleRowCount property. The user is able to change the visible rows by moving a grip with the mouse. The visibleRowCount property is changed accordingly.
Interactive.helpDescription: After rendering the table has as many rows as defined in visibleRowCount property. The user is able to change the visible rows by moving a grip with the mouse. The visibleRowCount property is changed accordingly.

Fixed.description: The table always has as many rows as defined in the visibleRowCount property.
Fixed.helpDescription: The table always has as many rows as defined in the visibleRowCount property.

hideGroupedColumn.description: Show grouped column only as group header
hideGroupedColumn.helpDescription: Show grouped column only as group header

showGroupedColumn.description: Show grouped column also as a column, not just as group header
showGroupedColumn.helpDescription: Show grouped column also as a column, not just as group header

moveDown.description: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position down in the group sequence
moveDown.helpDescription: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position down in the group sequence

moveUp.description: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position up in the group sequence
moveUp.helpDescription: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position up in the group sequence

Single.description: Select one row at a time.
Single.helpDescription: Select one row at a time.

Multi.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.ui.table.SelectionMode.MultiToggle}
Select multiple rows at a time.
Multi.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.ui.table.SelectionMode.MultiToggle}
Select multiple rows at a time.

MultiToggle.description: Select multiple rows at a time (toggle behavior).
MultiToggle.helpDescription: Select multiple rows at a time (toggle behavior).

RowSelector.description: Rows can only be selected on the row selector.
RowSelector.helpDescription: Rows can only be selected on the row selector.

Row.description: Rows can be selected on the complete row.
Row.helpDescription: Rows can be selected on the complete row.

RowOnly.description: Rows can only be selected on the row (and the selector is hidden).
RowOnly.helpDescription: Rows can only be selected on the row (and the selector is hidden).

table.description: The target table of this controller.
table.helpDescription: The target table of this controller.

sap.ui.table.TablePersoController.description: The TablePersoController can be used to connect a table with a persistence service.
sap.ui.table.TablePersoController.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TablePersoController. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getAutoSave autoSave} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPersoService persoService} : any
    • {@link #getCustomDataKey customDataKey} : string (default: persoKey)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.
sap.ui.table.TablePersoController.helpDescription: The TablePersoController can be used to connect a table with a persistence service.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

customDataKey.description: By defining a custom data key the TablePersoController will try to get the key for saving the perso data from the custom data of the Table and Column instead of creating it by concatenating the ID of the Table and the Column. Basically this will be more stable than using the auto IDs.
customDataKey.helpDescription: By defining a custom data key the TablePersoController will try to get the key for saving the perso data from the custom data of the Table and Column instead of creating it by concatenating the ID of the Table and the Column. Basically this will be more stable than using the auto IDs.

persoService.description:
Personalization Service object. Needs to have the following methods:
  • getPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • setPersData(oBundle) : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • delPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
persoService.helpDescription:
Personalization Service object. Needs to have the following methods:
  • getPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • setPersData(oBundle) : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • delPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.description:
Table which handles analytical OData backends. The AnalyticalTable only works with an AnalyticalBinding and
correctly annotated OData services. Please check on the SAP Annotations for OData Version 2.0 documentation for further details.
sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AnalyticalTable. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getSumOnTop sumOnTop} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNumberOfExpandedLevels numberOfExpandedLevels} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getAutoExpandMode autoExpandMode} : string (default: Bundled)
    • {@link #getColumnVisibilityMenuSorter columnVisibilityMenuSorter} : any
    • {@link #getCollapseRecursive collapseRecursive} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDirty dirty} : boolean
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.table.Table#constructor sap.ui.table.Table} can be used as well.
sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.helpDescription:
Table which handles analytical OData backends. The AnalyticalTable only works with an AnalyticalBinding and
correctly annotated OData services. Please check on the SAP Annotations for OData Version 2.0 documentation for further details.

toolbar.description: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
toolbar.helpDescription: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

extension.description: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
extension.helpDescription: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

footer.description: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
footer.helpDescription: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

noData.description:
The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string
value this will simply replace the no data text.
noData.helpDescription:
The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string
value this will simply replace the no data text.

title.description: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
title.helpDescription: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

fixedColumnCount.description:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.
fixedColumnCount.helpDescription:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.

enableCustomFilter.description:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.helpDescription:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

enableColumnFreeze.description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.
enableColumnFreeze.helpDescription: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

showOverlay.description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.
showOverlay.helpDescription: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

sumOnTop.description: Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum.
sumOnTop.helpDescription: Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum.

enableBusyIndicator.description:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.
enableBusyIndicator.helpDescription:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.

threshold.description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.helpDescription: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

enableGrouping.description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)
enableGrouping.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

collapseRecursive.description: Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
collapseRecursive.helpDescription: Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.

columnHeaderHeight.description: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.
columnHeaderHeight.helpDescription: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

numberOfExpandedLevels.description: Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data).
numberOfExpandedLevels.helpDescription: Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data).

showColumnVisibilityMenu.description:
Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu. This menu will get displayed in each
generated column header menu. It allows to show or hide columns
showColumnVisibilityMenu.helpDescription:
Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu. This menu will get displayed in each
generated column header menu. It allows to show or hide columns

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

visibleRowCountMode.description:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.
visibleRowCountMode.helpDescription:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.

columnVisibilityMenuSorter.description: Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.
columnVisibilityMenuSorter.helpDescription: Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.

rowHeight.description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.
rowHeight.helpDescription: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

dirty.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed.
dirty.helpDescription:

the table will just show a grid of empty cells

enableSelectAll.description:
Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed
if the row selector is visible and the selection mode is set to any kind of multi selection.

selectedIndex.description:
Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1.
When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns
the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method
removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.

selectionBehavior.description:
Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both
can be clicked to select a row.

navigationMode.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 there is no replacement, since Scrollbar is the only supported option
Determines whether a scrollbar or a paginator is used for navigation inside the table. If the paginator mode is used, it requires the sap.ui.commons library. This renders a scrollbar as a navigation element. Data fetched from an OData service is still loaded page-wise no matter which visual representation is used for navigation inside the table.

For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.

sap.ui.table.Table.description:
Provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. The Table control supports desktop PCs and tablet devices. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

In order to keep the document DOM as lean as possible, the Table control reuses its DOM elements of the rows. When the user scrolls, only the row contexts are changed but the rendered controls remain the same. This allows the Table control to handle huge amounts of data. Nevertheless, restrictions apply regarding the number of displayed columns. Keep the number as low as possible to improve performance. Due to the nature of tables, the used control for column templates also has a big influence on the performance.

The Table control relies completely on data binding, and its supported feature set is tightly coupled to the data model and binding being used.
sap.ui.table.Table.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Table. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getRowHeight rowHeight} : int
    • {@link #getColumnHeaderHeight columnHeaderHeight} : int
    • {@link #getColumnHeaderVisible columnHeaderVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisibleRowCount visibleRowCount} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getFirstVisibleRow firstVisibleRow} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ui.table.SelectionMode (default: MultiToggle)
    • {@link #getSelectionBehavior selectionBehavior} : sap.ui.table.SelectionBehavior (default: RowSelector)
    • {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNavigationMode navigationMode} : sap.ui.table.NavigationMode (default: Scrollbar)
    • {@link #getThreshold threshold} : int (default: 100)
    • {@link #getEnableColumnReordering enableColumnReordering} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableGrouping enableGrouping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowColumnVisibilityMenu showColumnVisibilityMenu} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowNoData showNoData} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisibleRowCountMode visibleRowCountMode} : sap.ui.table.VisibleRowCountMode (default: Fixed)
    • {@link #getMinAutoRowCount minAutoRowCount} : int (default: 5)
    • {@link #getFixedColumnCount fixedColumnCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getFixedRowCount fixedRowCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getFixedBottomRowCount fixedBottomRowCount} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEnableColumnFreeze enableColumnFreeze} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableCellFilter enableCellFilter} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowOverlay showOverlay} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSelectAll enableSelectAll} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableCustomFilter enableCustomFilter} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableBusyIndicator enableBusyIndicator} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.ui.core.Control|string
    • {@link #getFooter footer} : sap.ui.core.Control|string
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.ui.core.Toolbar
    • {@link #getExtension extension} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.ui.table.Column[] (default)
    • {@link #getRows rows} : sap.ui.table.Row[]
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : sap.ui.core.Control|string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rowSelectionChange rowSelectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:columnSelect columnSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:columnResize columnResize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:columnMove columnMove} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sort sort} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filter filter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:group group} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:columnVisibility columnVisibility} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cellClick cellClick} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cellContextmenu cellContextmenu} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:columnFreeze columnFreeze} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:customFilter customFilter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:firstVisibleRowChanged firstVisibleRowChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:busyStateChanged busyStateChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

Provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. The Table control supports desktop PCs and tablet devices. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

In order to keep the document DOM as lean as possible, the Table control reuses its DOM elements of the rows. When the user scrolls, only the row contexts are changed but the rendered controls remain the same. This allows the Table control to handle huge amounts of data. Nevertheless, restrictions apply regarding the number of displayed columns. Keep the number as low as possible to improve performance. Due to the nature of tables, the used control for column templates also has a big influence on the performance.

The Table control relies completely on data binding, and its supported feature set is tightly coupled to the data model and binding being used.

LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.

The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string

title.helpDescription: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

fixedColumnCount.description:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.
fixedColumnCount.helpDescription:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.

enableCustomFilter.description:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.helpDescription:

enableColumnFreeze.description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.
enableColumnFreeze.helpDescription: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

showOverlay.description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.
showOverlay.helpDescription: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

enableBusyIndicator.description:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.
enableBusyIndicator.helpDescription:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.

threshold.description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.helpDescription: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

enableGrouping.description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)
enableGrouping.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

columnHeaderHeight.description: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.
columnHeaderHeight.helpDescription: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

showColumnVisibilityMenu.description:
Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu. This menu will get displayed in each
generated column header menu. It allows to show or hide columns
showColumnVisibilityMenu.helpDescription:

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

visibleRowCountMode.description:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.
visibleRowCountMode.helpDescription:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.

rowHeight.description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.
rowHeight.helpDescription: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

showNoData.description:
Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty. If set to false
the table will just show a grid of empty cells
showNoData.helpDescription:
Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty. If set to false
the table will just show a grid of empty cells

enableSelectAll.description:
Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed
if the row selector is visible and the selection mode is set to any kind of multi selection.
enableSelectAll.helpDescription:
Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner. This button is only displayed

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

selectedIndex.description:
Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1.
When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns
the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method
removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.
selectedIndex.helpDescription:
Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1.
When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns

Selection behavior of the Table. This property defines whether the row selector is displayed and whether the row, the row selector or both
can be clicked to select a row.

navigationMode.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 there is no replacement, since Scrollbar is the only supported option
Determines whether a scrollbar or a paginator is used for navigation inside the table. If the paginator mode is used, it requires the sap.ui.commons library. This renders a scrollbar as a navigation element. Data fetched from an OData service is still loaded page-wise no matter which visual representation is used for navigation inside the table.

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalColumn.description: This column adds additional properties to the table column which are needed for the analytical binding and table
sap.ui.table.AnalyticalColumn.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AnalyticalColumn. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getLeadingProperty leadingProperty} : string
    • {@link #getSummed summed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInResult inResult} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowIfGrouped showIfGrouped} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getGroupHeaderFormatter groupHeaderFormatter} : any
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.table.Column#constructor sap.ui.table.Column} can be used as well.

template.description:
Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column, which means after
changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is
required. The default depends on the loaded libraries.
template.helpDescription:
Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column, which means after
changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is
required. The default depends on the loaded libraries.

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

multiLabels.description:
Labels of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for
each header row in the table. Use this aggregation if you want to use multiple headers per column.
multiLabels.helpDescription:
Labels of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for
each header row in the table. Use this aggregation if you want to use multiple headers per column.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

label.description:
Label of the column which is displayed in the column header. This aggregation is for the standard behavior,
where you only want to display one single row header. If a string is supplied, a default label control will be
created. Which control this is depends on the loaded libraries.
label.helpDescription:
Label of the column which is displayed in the column header. This aggregation is for the standard behavior,
where you only want to display one single row header. If a string is supplied, a default label control will be
created. Which control this is depends on the loaded libraries.

menu.description: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used. Note: Applications must not use or change the default sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu of a column in any way or create own instances of sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu. To add a custom menu to a column, use the aggregation menu with a new instance of sap.ui.unified.Menu.
menu.helpDescription: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used. Note: Applications must not use or change the default sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu of a column in any way or create own instances of sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu. To add a custom menu to a column, use the aggregation menu with a new instance of sap.ui.unified.Menu.

summed.description: If defined a sum for this column is calculated
summed.helpDescription: If defined a sum for this column is calculated

showIfGrouped.description: Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group.
showIfGrouped.helpDescription: Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group.

hAlign.description:
Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit
the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.
hAlign.helpDescription:
Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit
the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

sortProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the sort shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for sorting must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as sortProperty. A column menu entry for sorting can only be generated if the sortProperty is set.
sortProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the sort shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for sorting must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as sortProperty. A column menu entry for sorting can only be generated if the sortProperty is set.

showFilterMenuEntry.description: Defines if the filter menu entry is displayed
showFilterMenuEntry.helpDescription: Defines if the filter menu entry is displayed

leadingProperty.description: Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.
leadingProperty.helpDescription: Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.

filtered.description: Indicates if the column is filtered. This property only controls if a filter indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the filter function. The column has to be filtered by calling Column.sort()
filtered.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is filtered. This property only controls if a filter indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the filter function. The column has to be filtered by calling Column.sort()

defaultFilterOperator.description: If this property is set, the default filter operator of the column is overridden. By default Contains is used for string and EQ for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.
defaultFilterOperator.helpDescription: If this property is set, the default filter operator of the column is overridden. By default Contains is used for string and EQ for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.

inResult.description: Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column.
inResult.helpDescription: Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column.

filterOperator.description: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.
filterOperator.helpDescription: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

grouped.description: Indicates if the column is grouped.
grouped.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is grouped.

resizable.description:
If set to true, the column can be resized either using the resize-handle (by mouse) or using
the keyboard (SHIFT + Left/Right Arrow keys)
resizable.helpDescription:
If set to true, the column can be resized either using the resize-handle (by mouse) or using
the keyboard (SHIFT + Left/Right Arrow keys)

filterProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column shall be filtered. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the filter shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for filtering must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as filterProperty. A column menu entry for filtering can only be generated if the filterProperty is set. The default menu entry is a text input field.
filterProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column shall be filtered. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the filter shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for filtering must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as filterProperty. A column menu entry for filtering can only be generated if the filterProperty is set. The default menu entry is a text input field.

headerSpan.description: If this property is set, a span is applied for the header. When moving columns, all columns which are part of the header will be moved. The headerSpan can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer, this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a separate span for each header row.
headerSpan.helpDescription: If this property is set, a span is applied for the header. When moving columns, all columns which are part of the header will be moved. The headerSpan can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer, this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a separate span for each header row.

sorted.description: Indicates if the column is sorted. This property only controls if a sort indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the sort function. The column has to be sorted by calling Column.sort()
sorted.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is sorted. This property only controls if a sort indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the sort function. The column has to be sorted by calling Column.sort()

autoResizable.description: Enables auto-resizing of the column on double-clicking the resizer. The width is determined on the widest currently displayed content. It does not consider rows which are currently not scrolled into view. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link, sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox
autoResizable.helpDescription: Enables auto-resizing of the column on double-clicking the resizer. The width is determined on the widest currently displayed content. It does not consider rows which are currently not scrolled into view. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link, sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox

groupHeaderFormatter.description: If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header
groupHeaderFormatter.helpDescription: If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header

filterValue.description:
Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the proper data type). It is possible to provide a filterOperator as string, as shown here: 
> 50
< 100
>= 150
<= 200
= 250
!= 300
*something    ends with
something*    starts with
*something*   contains
some..thing   between
50..100       between
filterValue.helpDescription:
Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the proper data type). It is possible to provide a filterOperator as string, as shown here: 
> 50
< 100
>= 150
<= 200
= 250
!= 300
*something    ends with
something*    starts with
*something*   contains
some..thing   between
50..100       between

flexible.description:
If the table is wider than the sum of widths of the visible columns, the columns will be
resized proportionally to their widths that were set originally. If set to false, the column will be displayed in the
original width. If all columns are set to not be flexible, an extra "dummy" column will be
created at the end of the table.
flexible.helpDescription:
If the table is wider than the sum of widths of the visible columns, the columns will be
resized proportionally to their widths that were set originally. If set to false, the column will be displayed in the
original width. If all columns are set to not be flexible, an extra "dummy" column will be
created at the end of the table.

showSortMenuEntry.helpDescription: Defines if the sort menu entries are displayed

sortOrder.description: This property indicates the sort direction (Ascending or Descending). The corresponding icon will be rendered if the property sorted is true
sortOrder.helpDescription: This property indicates the sort direction (Ascending or Descending). The corresponding icon will be rendered if the property sorted is true

width.description: Width of the column. Works only with px/em/rem values. Em are handled like rem values.
width.helpDescription: Width of the column. Works only with px/em/rem values. Em are handled like rem values.

name.description:
The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text.
If not set as a fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.
name.helpDescription:
The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text.
If not set as a fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.

filterType.description: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As an alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the class name of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.
filterType.helpDescription: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As an alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the class name of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

sap.ui.table.TreeTable.description: The TreeTable control provides a comprehensive set of features to display hierarchical data.
sap.ui.table.TreeTable.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TreeTable. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getExpandFirstLevel expandFirstLevel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUseGroupMode useGroupMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getGroupHeaderProperty groupHeaderProperty} : string
    • {@link #getCollapseRecursive collapseRecursive} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRootLevel rootLevel} : int (default: 0)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:toggleOpenState toggleOpenState} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.table.Table#constructor sap.ui.table.Table} can be used as well.
sap.ui.table.TreeTable.helpDescription: The TreeTable control provides a comprehensive set of features to display hierarchical data.

toolbar.description: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
toolbar.helpDescription: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance.
The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string
value this will simply replace the no data text.

title.helpDescription: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

fixedColumnCount.description:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.
fixedColumnCount.helpDescription:
Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only
the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
Please note that the aggregated width of all fixed columns must not exceed the table width since there
will be no scrollbar for fixed columns.

enableCustomFilter.description:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.helpDescription:
Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button
will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

enableColumnFreeze.description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.
enableColumnFreeze.helpDescription: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

rootLevel.description:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.
rootLevel.helpDescription:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.

showOverlay.description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.
showOverlay.helpDescription: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

expandFirstLevel.description: Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level.
expandFirstLevel.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level.

groupHeaderProperty.description: The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled
groupHeaderProperty.helpDescription: The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled

enableBusyIndicator.description:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.
enableBusyIndicator.helpDescription:
Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own.
The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area. This feature can only
be used when the navigation mode is set to scrolling.

threshold.description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.helpDescription: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. If the threshold is lower than the visibleRowCount, the visibleRowCount will be used as the threshold. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

enableGrouping.description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)
enableGrouping.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

useGroupMode.description:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)
useGroupMode.helpDescription:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)

collapseRecursive.description:
Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

visibleRowCountMode.description:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.
visibleRowCountMode.helpDescription:
This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is,
that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is
changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is
allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of
the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change
the visibleRowCount interactively.

Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1.
When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns
the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method
removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.
