sap.ui.table.Column.description: The column allows you to define column specific properties that will be applied when rendering the table.
sap.ui.table.Column.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Column. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getFlexible flexible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHAlign hAlign} : sap.ui.core.HorizontalAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getSorted sorted} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSortOrder sortOrder} : sap.ui.table.SortOrder (default: Ascending)
    • {@link #getSortProperty sortProperty} : string
    • {@link #getFiltered filtered} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFilterProperty filterProperty} : string
    • {@link #getFilterValue filterValue} : string
    • {@link #getFilterOperator filterOperator} : string
    • {@link #getDefaultFilterOperator defaultFilterOperator} : string
    • {@link #getFilterType filterType} : any
    • {@link #getGrouped grouped} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getShowFilterMenuEntry showFilterMenuEntry} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSortMenuEntry showSortMenuEntry} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeaderSpan headerSpan} : any (default: 1)
    • {@link #getAutoResizable autoResizable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLabel label} : sap.ui.core.Control|string (default)
    • {@link #getMultiLabels multiLabels} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getTemplate template} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getMenu menu} : sap.ui.unified.Menu
  • Events
    • {@link #event:columnMenuOpen columnMenuOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.table.Column.helpDescription: The column allows you to define column specific properties that will be applied when rendering the table.

template.description:
Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column, which means after
changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is
required. The default depends on the loaded libraries.
template.helpDescription:
Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column, which means after
changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is
required. The default depends on the loaded libraries.

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

multiLabels.description:
Labels of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for
each header row in the table. Use this aggregation if you want to use multiple headers per column.
multiLabels.helpDescription:
Labels of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for
each header row in the table. Use this aggregation if you want to use multiple headers per column.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

label.description:
Label of the column which is displayed in the column header. This aggregation is for the standard behavior,
where you only want to display one single row header. If a string is supplied, a default label control will be
created. Which control this is depends on the loaded libraries.
label.helpDescription:
Label of the column which is displayed in the column header. This aggregation is for the standard behavior,
where you only want to display one single row header. If a string is supplied, a default label control will be
created. Which control this is depends on the loaded libraries.

menu.description: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used. Note: Applications must not use or change the default sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu of a column in any way or create own instances of sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu. To add a custom menu to a column, use the aggregation menu with a new instance of sap.ui.unified.Menu.
menu.helpDescription: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used. Note: Applications must not use or change the default sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu of a column in any way or create own instances of sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu. To add a custom menu to a column, use the aggregation menu with a new instance of sap.ui.unified.Menu.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

hAlign.description:
Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit
the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.
hAlign.helpDescription:
Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit
the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.

grouped.description: Indicates if the column is grouped.
grouped.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is grouped.

resizable.description:
If set to true, the column can be resized either using the resize-handle (by mouse) or using
the keyboard (SHIFT + Left/Right Arrow keys)
resizable.helpDescription:
If set to true, the column can be resized either using the resize-handle (by mouse) or using
the keyboard (SHIFT + Left/Right Arrow keys)

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

sortProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the sort shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for sorting must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as sortProperty. A column menu entry for sorting can only be generated if the sortProperty is set.
sortProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the sort shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for sorting must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as sortProperty. A column menu entry for sorting can only be generated if the sortProperty is set.

filterProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column shall be filtered. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the filter shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for filtering must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as filterProperty. A column menu entry for filtering can only be generated if the filterProperty is set. The default menu entry is a text input field.
filterProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column shall be filtered. Since the column template may have composite bindings, it's not possible to figure out on which binding property the filter shall be applied. Therefore the binding property for filtering must be specified. For example, if the first name and last name are displayed in the same column, only one of the two can be defined as filterProperty. A column menu entry for filtering can only be generated if the filterProperty is set. The default menu entry is a text input field.

headerSpan.description: If this property is set, a span is applied for the header. When moving columns, all columns which are part of the header will be moved. The headerSpan can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer, this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a separate span for each header row.
headerSpan.helpDescription: If this property is set, a span is applied for the header. When moving columns, all columns which are part of the header will be moved. The headerSpan can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer, this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a separate span for each header row.

showFilterMenuEntry.description: Defines if the filter menu entry is displayed
showFilterMenuEntry.helpDescription: Defines if the filter menu entry is displayed

sorted.description: Indicates if the column is sorted. This property only controls if a sort indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the sort function. The column has to be sorted by calling Column.sort()
sorted.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is sorted. This property only controls if a sort indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the sort function. The column has to be sorted by calling Column.sort()

autoResizable.description: Enables auto-resizing of the column on double-clicking the resizer. The width is determined on the widest currently displayed content. It does not consider rows which are currently not scrolled into view. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link, sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox
autoResizable.helpDescription: Enables auto-resizing of the column on double-clicking the resizer. The width is determined on the widest currently displayed content. It does not consider rows which are currently not scrolled into view. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link, sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox

filtered.description: Indicates if the column is filtered. This property only controls if a filter indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the filter function. The column has to be filtered by calling Column.sort()
filtered.helpDescription: Indicates if the column is filtered. This property only controls if a filter indicator is displayed in the column header - it does not trigger the filter function. The column has to be filtered by calling Column.sort()

filterValue.description:
Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the proper data type). It is possible to provide a filterOperator as string, as shown here: 
> 50
< 100
>= 150
<= 200
= 250
!= 300
*something    ends with
something*    starts with
*something*   contains
some..thing   between
50..100       between

Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the proper data type). It is possible to provide a filterOperator as string, as shown here: 
> 50
< 100
>= 150
<= 200
= 250
!= 300

something*    starts with
*something*   contains

flexible.description:
If the table is wider than the sum of widths of the visible columns, the columns will be
resized proportionally to their widths that were set originally. If set to false, the column will be displayed in the
original width. If all columns are set to not be flexible, an extra "dummy" column will be
created at the end of the table.
flexible.helpDescription:
If the table is wider than the sum of widths of the visible columns, the columns will be
resized proportionally to their widths that were set originally. If set to false, the column will be displayed in the
original width. If all columns are set to not be flexible, an extra "dummy" column will be
created at the end of the table.

defaultFilterOperator.description: If this property is set, the default filter operator of the column is overridden. By default Contains is used for string and EQ for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.
defaultFilterOperator.helpDescription: If this property is set, the default filter operator of the column is overridden. By default Contains is used for string and EQ for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.

showSortMenuEntry.description: Defines if the sort menu entries are displayed
showSortMenuEntry.helpDescription: Defines if the sort menu entries are displayed

sortOrder.description: This property indicates the sort direction (Ascending or Descending). The corresponding icon will be rendered if the property sorted is true
sortOrder.helpDescription: This property indicates the sort direction (Ascending or Descending). The corresponding icon will be rendered if the property sorted is true

width.description: Width of the column. Works only with px/em/rem values. Em are handled like rem values.
width.helpDescription: Width of the column. Works only with px/em/rem values. Em are handled like rem values.

name.description:
The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text.
If not set as a fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.
name.helpDescription:
The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text.
If not set as a fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.

filterOperator.description: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.
filterOperator.helpDescription: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

filterType.description: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As an alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the class name of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.
filterType.helpDescription: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As an alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the class name of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.

sap.ui.table.Row.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Row. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCells cells} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

layoutData.description:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription:
Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout.
LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout.
See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached, keyed by the model names. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setModel(models[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single model instance can be given which will be set as default model.

objectBindings.description: A map of binding paths keyed by the corresponding model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.bindObject(objectBindings[k], k);. For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single binding path can be given which will be bound for the default model.

id.description:
Unique ID of this instance.

If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework.
AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for IDs that the application (or other code) creates.
It can be configured by using option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of {@link sap.ui.model.Context} instances keyed by their model name. Each entry with key k in this object has the same effect as a call to this.setBindingContext(bindingContexts[k], k). For the default model, String(undefined) must be used as key. Instead of a map, a single context can be given which will be set for the default model.
